Very friendly staff who speaks English.  Very basic tapas - mostly cured meat, cheese, salad, and sandwiches.  No hot tapas - which I was hoping for.  A good place if you want a no frill, basic meal with wine.  We had the meat combination (salami, ham, etc), ham with Brie sandwich, veal sand which, and turkey salad, and most importantly..a glass of Rioja.
